item.title: Things you can test, PlanetScale migrations, and validated DTOs
item.itunes:title: Things you can test, PlanetScale migrations, and validated DTOs
item.description:
Jake and Michael discuss all the latest Laravel releases, tutorials, and happenings in the community.

This episode is sponsored by Honeybadger - combining error monitoring, uptime monitoring and check-in monitoring into a single, easy to use platform and making you a DevOps hero.

  • (05:34) - Laravel 10.5 released
  • (10:47) - Everything you can test in your Laravel application
  • (13:38) - Replace raw query calls with Laravel Query Expressions
  • (19:12) - Validated DTO package for Laravel
  • (22:14) - Sponsor: Honeybadger
  • (23:16) - PlanetScale database migrations for Laravel
  • (28:47) - Laravel expectations plugin for Pest
  • (32:06) - Useful Laravel date scopes for Eloquent models
  • (35:06) - Pest architecture plugin
  • (36:11) - Let's talk about form requests

item.title: Dusters, Pest, and Flaky APIs
item.itunes:title: Dusters, Pest, and Flaky APIs
item.description:
Jake and Michael discuss all the latest Laravel releases, tutorials, and happenings in the community.

This episode is sponsored by Honeybadger - combining error monitoring, uptime monitoring and check-in monitoring into a single, easy to use platform and making you a DevOps hero.

  • (02:35) - Laravel 10.2
  • (04:28) - Laravel 10.3
  • (11:34) - Linti and fix your Laravel code with Duster
  • (14:43) - The future of Pest v2
  • (17:58) - Sponsor: Honeybadger
  • (19:05) - Filter and search Eloquent models with the model filter package
  • (22:34) - Laravel notification log
  • (25:04) - Flaky for Laravel
  • (29:55) - A PHP SDK for the Dolby API

  • (40:04) - Building a kanban board with Laravel and Vue.Draggable
  • Using PSR-3 placeholders properly
  • Pest Converter - Convert your tests from PHPUnit to Pest

item.title: PHP 8.2, Laravel 10, and storytime with Jake
item.itunes:title: PHP 8.2, Laravel 10, and storytime with Jake
item.description:
Jake and Michael discuss all the latest Laravel releases, tutorials, and happenings in the community.

This episode is sponsored by Honeybadger - combining error monitoring, uptime monitoring and check-in monitoring into a single, easy to use platform and making you a DevOps hero.

  • (03:10) - Laravel 9.43 released
  • (07:45) - A look at what's coming to Laravel 10
  • (13:15) - PHP 8.2 is released with read-only classes, new standalone types, trait constants, and more

  • (29:56) - Supercharging your artisan commands with Termwind

  • What's new in PHP 8.2
  • NeoVim Conference

item.title: Laravel releases, Laracon Online, and soft edges
item.itunes:title: Laravel releases, Laracon Online, and soft edges
item.description:
Jake and Michael return for 2018 and catch up on several framework releases from the break, discuss the upcoming Laracon Online, and community projects from Chris Fidao and Steve Schoger.

Show links

  • Laravel 5.5.23 released
    • Collection::firstWhere()
  • Laravel 5.5.25 released
    • Added support for Flysystem caching (Caching example from Jason Varga)
    • Added support for year data type
    • Added support for setting Whoops debug editor
      • Open files in an editor
  • Laravel 5.5.27 released
    • Support passing collections to Collection::except (5.5.26)
    • Made Command class macroable (5.5.26)
    • Allow chaining of Request::merge() calls (5.5.27)
    • Performance improvements of Model::getTable() reverted (5.5.27)
  • Laravel 5.5.28 released
    • Added AnonymousNotifiable::notifyNow() method
    • Added EventFake::assertDispatchedTimes() method
  • Chrome 63 now forces .dev domains to HTTPS
  • Laracon Online
  • Bootstrap 4 final beta released
  • Bootstrap 4 Laravel preset for Laravel 5.5
  • Free Video Course: Scaling your Laravel applications on Forge
  • Scaling Forge
  • Introducing Heroicons UI - be notified when more icons are added
  • Disneyland Adventures

Tip of the day:

Make the CD command case insensitive by adding the following to your ~/.inputrc file:

set completion-ignore-case on

item.title: Laravel Valet with Taylor Otwell and Adam Wathan
item.itunes:title: Laravel Valet with Taylor Otwell and Adam Wathan
item.description:
Laravel Valet is a new high-speed development environment by Taylor Otwell and Adam Wathan.

In this special edition episode of the Laravel News Podcast Eric and Jack are Joined by Taylor and Adam as they discuss everything about Valet, how it came to be and the amazingly short time from idea to completed product. They talk about the internals, how it works, how external sharing works, the driver architecture and more.

An audio copy of the Official Valet Commerical is at the end of the episode

Show Links

  • Valet Announcement
  • First look at Valet
  • The magic behind Valet

item.title: Interview with Mike Bronner about his early experiences with Laravel Spark
item.itunes:title: Interview with Mike Bronner about his early experiences with Laravel Spark
item.description:
Jack reads the news and interviews Mike Bronner while Eric takes a much needed week off.

  • Eric sent out his 100th episode of the Laravel News Newsletter!
  • Interview with Mike Bronner (@mikebronner) who shares his experiences being one of the first users to get Spark into production.
  • Mike talked about larachat live @larachatlive that meet Thursdays at 7pm CST
  • ViewJS 2.0
  • PHP RFC: Pipe operator

Book updates:

  • Easy Laravel 5 Book and companion Website
  • Laravel 5.2 for beginners by Bill Keck
  • CodeSmart by Dayle Rees
  • Working With Forge Servers -by Jack Fruh & Friends

Tutorials:

  • Generate Fake Localized data with laravel
  • Tweet Streaming With laravel by Daniel Abernathy
  • Using SparkPost for Transactional emails with Laravel
  • Run tests inside your deploy script
  • EcmaScript 6 Crash Course
  • Conditionally adding to Laravel Query Builder

Packages:

  • BeautyMail
  • Laravel Generators
  • Laravel Friendships
  • UUID generator
  • Spatie Laravel Newsletter Package

item.title: Covering a few community Laravel packages
item.itunes:title: Covering a few community Laravel packages
item.description:
In this episode we talk about Laravel Exception Reporter, Chrome Bandwidth limiter, Chrome extension to generate Laravel tests, Jigsaw, Helpspot Vault, Fixing MySql Memory, Sparkwatch, Taxes, Jack runs into a laravel problem that Eric helps with.

  • Spark breaking news
  • 3:15 Laravel Exception reporter - emails you anytime an exception is logged.
  • 5:30 Chrome bandwidth limiter for testing.
  • 7:10 Chrome extension to generate Laravel tests.
  • 9:55 Jigsaw
  • 13:20 Userscape helpspot Vault - an expiring way to send info.
  • 15:10 Dropbox - share a file for a week
  • 17:00 Mysql is still holding for Jack on 2gb,
  • 17:15 Laravel tweeted that Mysql might know the root cause.
  • 17:20 James Fairhurst wrote to tell us that Forge servers do not have swap files and it's just a few commands to add one.
  • 19:10 SparkWatch continues, Jack predicts the 100th day of the year. April 9th.
  • 22:00 taxes in the US - Jack and Eric chat about paying taxes on side work.
  • 33:15 Eric helps Jack through a laravel problem involving a complex query and how to get that into a blade template.

Show links

  • Chrome extension to generate tests
  • Exception Recorder
  • Jigsaw
  • Vault
  • Adding a swap file to a linux box

PS (We don't say in the show what spark is, it's a starter project that has billing, invoicing, subscriptions, user management and more built in)

Also Star Wars Force unleashed was released on DVD and BluRay today...

item.title: Composer updates, Laravel Backup 3, Katana, Mail Preview Driver, and more...
item.itunes:title: Composer updates, Laravel Backup 3, Katana, Mail Preview Driver, and more...
item.description:
In this episode, we talk about the latest Laravel news including Composer updates, Github Relaxing their API limit, Laravel internals moving to Github issues. Then we talk about a few recent packages released including Katana, Laravel Backup 3, and a new mail preview driver.

News this week

  • Internals moved to Github
  • Github removes the API limit on composer installs
  • Update composer.json

Code and Packages

  • Katana
  • Laravel Backup 3
  • Mail preview driver

Easter Eggs.

Yep, this episode has several. They're easy to find if you start at the beginning and listen until the end...

item.title: PHP7, Laravel 5.2, LaraVer, and interviews with Colin O'Dell and Mike Bronner
item.itunes:title: PHP7, Laravel 5.2, LaraVer, and interviews with Colin O'Dell and Mike Bronner
item.description:
Show Notes

PHP 7:

Colin O'Dell, author of PHP 7 UpgradeGuide Joins us to share new features of PHP7 and advice on things listeners might want to check before upgrading to PHP7.

Laraver

Mike Bronner joins us to talk about Laraver.xyz a new service that monitors the change logs for Laravel in Github

Show Links

  • What is coming to Laravel 5.2?

  • Forge now supports LetsEncrypt.

  • Flexbox Froggy is a cool intro to learn flexbox.

End of year update

This is our last episode for 2015, we'll be back on January 8th with more Laravel News!
item.content:encoded:
Show Notes

PHP 7:

Colin O'Dell, author of PHP 7 UpgradeGuide Joins us to share new features of PHP7 and advice on things listeners might want to check before upgrading to PHP7.

Laraver

Mike Bronner joins us to talk about Laraver.xyz a new service that monitors the change logs for Laravel in Github

Show Links

  • What is coming to Laravel 5.2?

  • Forge now supports LetsEncrypt.

  • Flexbox Froggy is a cool intro to learn flexbox.

End of year update

This is our last episode for 2015, we'll be back on January 8th with more Laravel News!
